questions.question: A turtle ………………………… many eggs at one time.
…………………………. the cartons one on top of the other.
questions.description: To lay something is to put it down carefully.

questions.question: I ………………………. the plates on the table.
questions.description: Laid is the past tense of lay.

questions.question: She was angry with me because I ……………………… to her.
questions.description: Lied is the past tense of lie. To lie is to say something untrue.

questions.question: I …………………….. down and closed my eyes but I could not sleep.
questions.description: When lie means be down, lay is its past tense.

questions.question: Sam earns the most money in our family James earns …………………….
questions.description: The least is the opposite of the most. It is used with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: The essay with ………………………. errors is not always the best.
questions.description: With plural nouns we use fewest and with uncountable nouns we use least.

questions.question: She always arrives when you …………………………. expect it.
questions.description: When least is used as an adverb, it is used without the.

questions.question: I am ………………………….. interested in this offer.
……………………….. people cook their own meals these days.
questions.description: We use fewer with plural nouns.

questions.question: The most effective way to lose weight is to eat ……………………… food.
questions.description: Less is the comparative of little.
